name: Introduction to Media Studies
description: This course provides a general introduction to media studies, covering topics such as media literacy, media history, media technology, and media effects.

name: Media Effects Theory and Research
description: This course provides an overview of media effects theory and research, covering topics such as agenda-setting theory, cultivation theory, framing theory, and moral panics.

name: Media Effects Research Methods
description: This course provides an overview of media effects research methods, covering topics such as survey methods, content analysis, and experimental design.

name: Advanced Media Effects Research
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of media effects research, covering topics such as longitudinal research, diffusion of innovations, and health communication.
